Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Allow deletion of unconfirmed users and orgs" (#7948) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Fix minor styling issue on the delete account page when an exception bubbles out.
Fix bug in the account delete handler which would not delete users when notifications were turned off.
Address https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3099

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search] Opt-out of Azure Search's relevancy changes" (#7947) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
⚠️ This will block search index rebuilds after July 15, 2020!

From Azure Search's documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/search/index-ranking-similarity

> Starting July 15, 2020, newly created search services will use the BM25 ranking function, which has proven in most cases to provide search rankings that align better with user expectations than the current default ranking. ... With this change, you will most likely see slight changes in the ordering of your search results. 
>
> For services created before July 15, 2020: If the similarity is omitted or set to null, the index will use the old classic similarity algorithm.
> 
> For services created after July 15, 2020: If the similarity is omitted or set to null, the index will use the new BM25 similarity algorithm.
> 
> You can also explicitly set the similarity value to be one of the following two values: "#Microsoft.Azure.Search.ClassicSimilarity" or "#Microsoft.Azure.Search.BM25Similarity".

We should opt-out of `BM25Similarity` until we have validated that these change improve relevancy for NuGet's search.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Waiting for validation. 2 days have passed." (#7946) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
Waiting for validation. 2 days have passed.

### Expected behavior
Typically after submitting a new version it's approved within several minutes, not days.

### Additional context
https://www.nuget.org/packages/Memory.dll/

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Package Renames] Remove download overrides" (#7945) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Today certain packages have their download counts overriden during popularity scoring. This was a stopgap until we supported package renames. We should remove download overrides. 

Part of https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7896

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Package Renames] Remove download overrides" (#7945) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Today certain packages have their download counts overriden during popularity scoring. This was a stopgap until we supported package renames. We should remove download overrides.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Package Renames] Add feature flag to undo all popularity transfers" (#7944) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Add a feature flag that, when activated, removes all popularity transfers in search. The Gallery UI should be unaffected by this feature flag.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Package Renames] Add documentation" (#7943) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "Improved link functionality for nuget.org" (#7942) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Summary of the changes (in less than 80 characters):

Support for packages/{id}/latest, packages/{id}/latest/prerelease and packages/{id}/latest/prerelease/{tagName}

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7835

This PR fixes #7835

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""Last updated" based on package version, not on last update" (#7941) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
Example: https://www.nuget.org/packages/MingweiSamuel.Camille

Here you can see the page displays "last updated 5 months ago" even though there are versions from 2 months ago and 30 minutes ago. This is because there are [newer versions](https://www.nuget.org/packages/MingweiSamuel.Camille/3.0.1-nightly-2019-11-07-8874098daa) (in terms of semvar) that I have hidden, but it seems the site only bases the "last updated" on that, not on the actual last update.


### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Upload an "older" version of an existing package, in terms of semvar
2. "last updated" will not update correctly

### Expected behavior
"last updated" should either be when any version was last updated, or when the last listed version was updated.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue ""Last updated" based on package version, not on lasted update" (#7941) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
Example: https://www.nuget.org/packages/MingweiSamuel.Camille/2.4.1

Here you can see the page displays "last updated 5 months ago" even though there are versions from 2 months ago and 30 minutes ago. This is because there are [newer versions](https://www.nuget.org/packages/MingweiSamuel.Camille/3.0.1-nightly-2019-11-07-8874098daa) (in terms of semvar) that I have hidden, but it seems the site only bases the "last updated" on that, not on the actual last update.


### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Upload an "older" version of a package, in terms of semvar
2. "last updated" will not update correctly

### Expected behavior
"last updated" should be based on when the project was last updated.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'IF'. returned while running 201904292139301_RemoveVulnerabilityDataFromPackageDeprecationModel.cs migration" (#7931) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I took the latest version master branch builded the solution configured the connection strings and ran: 

`Update-Database -ConfigurationTypeName MigrationsConfiguration`

in Package Manager Console on NuGetGallery project.

While running 201904292139301_RemoveVulnerabilityDataFromPackageDeprecationModel.cs migration the Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'IF'. 

The fix this I had to replace :

`Sql("ALTER TABLE [dbo].[PackageDeprecations] DROP CONSTRAINT IF EXISTS [dbo.PackageDeprecations_CVSSRating];");`
 
with

`Sql("IF EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.check_constraints WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo.PackageDeprecations_CVSSRating]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[PackageDeprecations]')) ALTER TABLE dbo.PackageDeprecations DROP CONSTRAINT [dbo.PackageDeprecations_CVSSRating];");`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enable a test when cross platform is implemented " (#8807) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The existing test ExecuteCommandAsync_WithMultiplePackagesAndInvalidCertificate_RaisesErrorsOnceAsync is enabled cross platform before. It's disabled as the test will call Signing APIs  which is not yet implemented.

We should enable this test cross platform when signing APIs are enabled cross platform.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "net5 tfm: "hydrating" empty TargetPlatformVersions" (#9444) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet itself doesn't have the information it needs in order to understand what version `net5.0-ios` and such might mean, but omitting versions is an important part of this feature.

After discussions with the dotnet and msbuild teams, my understanding is that they will "fill in" the `NuGetFramework` instances with the actual version using some API call that's yet to be determined (or, preferably, hand us a new one, so we can keep `NuGetFramework` immutable).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "net5: How will our insertions work?" (#9253) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: We need to make sure we understand any extra work that might be needed for our insertions into net5. I believe we are already doing these insertions, but in light of #9252, we might need to update documentation about expected test branches and such. This issue is mostly about making sure we understand everything and documenting anything we need to document.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Improve performance when counting packages that need updates in VS UI" (#2495) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Right now, we load the registration index and all pages. This is done pretty frequently, including:
- Every time the UI is opened.
- Every time the little search refresh button is clicked.
- More... I am not an expert in the area so it's hard to pin down for me.

We should think about the following improvements:
1. Add some kind of short-term caching. Right now, we never cache registration blobs.
2. Add throttling so if many packages have many registration blobs, we don't flood the user's network.
3. Improve the algorithm so that not all registration blobs are downloaded.
4. Add a new endpoint that is optimized for getting updates.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "net5 tfm: msbuild props supersede NuGetFramework data" (#9443) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: When present, msbuild props like `TargetPlatformIdentifier` and `TargetPlatformVersion` should supersede the corresponding data in `NuGetFramework` objects.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "net5 tfm: Warn on high TPMV" (#9442) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Produce a warning when a project consumes a library with a higher `TargetPlatformMinVersion`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "net5 tfm: produce error when missing TPV" (#9441) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Produce an error when a OS flavored .NET 5 TFM is consumed but the package has no TPV in either folder name of the manifest. Is this supposed to be during restore??

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "net5 tfm: fail pack when packing equivalent platforms" (#9440) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Fail pack when packing equivalent TFMs like net5.0-ios and net5.0-ios13.0 (note: we do want to eventually allow multi-targeting with equivalent TFMs, but that's out of scope for this work, and [seems to be a Big Task](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5154) -- also, we don't support them right now, so this isn't an issue yet)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "net5 tfm: TargetPlatformMinVersion in packed nuspec" (#9439) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Ensure Pack target passes TargetPlatformMinVersion to .nuspec generator.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "net5 tfm: design manifest entries" (#9438) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Design NuGet manifest entries for TargetPlatformVersion and TargetPlatformMinVersion (not sure what "design" is needed -- TPV should be treated as part of the tfm itself. TargetPlatformMinVersion is a separate, new attribute. This is a bit more involved than just passing it through.)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
